html: Isaiah’s word to Ahaz—“from Jehovah your God”—is twofold: (1) it is a symbolic reminder of Jehovah’s covenant with King David, Ahaz’ ancestor, including the idea that the scheme to overthrow Ahaz will bring covenant curses on those who attempt it (vv 1-9); and (2) it constitutes a “sign” or “confirmation” (’ot) that Jehovah will fulfill his promise (vv 10-17). Ahaz, however, responds with pious hypocrisy, quoting Deuteronomy 6:16 about not putting Jehovah to the test. In his disloyalty and inability to believe Jehovah’s word, Ahaz refuses confirmation and thus puts himself above Isaiah.
